You should have a healthy appreciation of facing a variety of diverse challenges outside of your comfort level and working under pressure. This position focuses on our core network as a service platform. 

A typical day in the life of a Core Platform Technical Program Manager might include:
* Working with sales, the customer support team, and customers to deeply understand the problems our customers face in deploying and using network connectivity and creating new use cases around these problems.
* Evangelizing products to customers, and serving as the subject matter expert.
* Working continuously on refinements and updates to the existing product for the best customer experience.
* Leading the network and software teams to get new features and products implemented.
* Reviewing technical specifications and capabilities with the network architecture team to make decisions on underlying hardware and protocols, creating software integration plans with software teams, and creating a holistic technical view of how to bring a product or feature into the customer portal.
* Working with software engineering to implement systems, test, and deploy systems - reviewing architecture as needed to ensure program goals are met.
* Writing engineering analysis and recommendations to stakeholders, then flipping the script and explaining product trade offs to engineers, all the while keeping scale and long term viability in mind with trade offs for faster execution.
* Researching additional ideas you may have to improve the platform overall and sharing with the product team.

* Technical knowledge of common network application architectures, features and functions, including routers, switches, firewalls, load balancers, SD-WAN appliances, etc.
* Proven experience in prioritizing development activities, writing requirements, and producing continual product improvements.
* Proficiency with Python, SQL and probably more languages.
* Proficiency with tools like Git, Jira, Confluence, LucidChart, Postman, and the Google Tools Suite (Docs/Sheets/Slides).
* Experience leading cross functional engineering teams, and collaborates well in a team environment.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, that accompany excellent organizational skills.
* A never ending drive to solve complex problems, move projects to completion, and gather feedback from customers.
* Experience creating key performance metrics, and measurements of product success.
* The mindset to automate everything, all the time.
* Never afraid to question notions or beliefs of how things should be done.
